intro: Trichostema austromontanum subsp. typicum, commonly known as the coastal bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in coastal scrub and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its arid environment. The species is known for its attractive appearance and is often used in native plant gardens.
